name: FastSloth & CrazyGator
description:
Control the sloth with the arrow keys. The goal is to keep the sloth alive by eating algae at a faster rate than his body loses energy, while avoiding predation by an alligator during 333 seconds of fun gameplay. The gator's behavior changes over time until he goes nuts and flies ... whaaaat? I know, real gators don't fly but ours is fun and we hope it makes you laugh.

This game  is a parent-child team project inspired on Thalassocnus spp., a group of semi-aquatic sloths that existed millions of years ago in  what is now South America. The game is the first of a series themed on the interactions between herbivores, carnivores, plants, and energy, illustrating how herbivores balance grazing with escaping from predators (carnivores) and how such balance affects their net energy. 

Please enjoy it and give us your feedback!!!
